pullRequest.body:
This is a continuation of #21281 with the end goal of defining topoi in Mathlib. It introduces the notion of a power object in a category with a subobject classifier, which is a special case of an internal hom.

The definition `HasPowerObjects C` contained in this PR is all that remains before `IsTopos C` can be defined.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [cfe32f1476](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22302/commits/cfe32f1476f5dc9a2811098d22f6628aa057835e)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Topos.Power` (new file)|634|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ HasPowerObjects`
`+ PowerObject`
`+ comm`
`+ in_`
`+ inverseImage`
`+ inverseImage_comm`
`+ inverseImage_id`
`+ pow`
`+ powFunctor`
`+ powFunctorOp`
`+ powSelfAdj`
`+ transpose`
`+ transposeEquiv`
`+ transposeEquivSymm`
`+ transposeInv`
`+ transposeSymm`
`+ transposeSymmInv`
`+ transposeTransposeEquiv`
`+ transpose_left_inv`
`+ transpose_right_inv`
`+ transpose_symm_left_inv`
`+ transpose_symm_right_inv`
`+ unique`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

It seems that you are requiring that the "right adjoint functor" to "B ⊗ -" is defined on the object `Ω C`. In the file `CategoryTheory.Closed.Monoidal`, if `Closed B` holds, then `B ⊗ -` has a right adjoint, so that the previous property holds for any object, in particular `Ω C`.
Then, at the very least, the notion of "power object" (or "internal hom") should be defined in the more general context of monoidal categories.
In the case of left adjoints, I introduced some API in `Adjunction.PartialAdjoint` where I define the "domain of definition" of a left adjoint (and the left adjoint indeed exists if this domain of definition is `⊤`).
I would suggest you start doing a PR which dualises the results in `Adjunction.PartialAdjoint` for right adjoints.
Then, in a second PR, a type class `HasInternalHom X Y` can be introduced (and if this holds for all `Y` for a given `X`, `Closed X` can be obtained).
Finally, in the context of toposes, `HasPowerObjects` could state that `HasInternalHom B (Ω C)` holds for all `B`.
(Note: for future PRs, it may be advisable to use the name `IsElementaryTopos`, as there could be a confusion with Grothendieck toposes which some users of mathlib are more accustomed to.)

pullRequest.title: feat: add `CategoryTheory.Topos.Power`
